item.title: sf.chlorodot mini-package
item.description: The basic idea of the dot chloropleths is to visualise not only the location clustering of each variable but the number of observations (something traditional ‘filled’ chloropleths don’t do). More importantly than this, the maps also just look really really cool…

item.title: The Knowledge 4th August 2018
item.description: Some longer chains involving cities happened in the 1920-1921 seasons in the Second Division, but it seems like the scheduling worked differently then and teams played back to back more, so doesn’t really…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - Rest of the World/UK
item.description: To save time, I’m gonig to used saved versions of the datasets I built up over the 5 blog posts. I won’t include the functions in this blog post either, but the article uses (at most very slight modified) functions from the previous 5 posts. We first need to sort the players into either the UK vs…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - Simulate World Cups
item.description: Now that we have the teams for each county, we want to work out how well they would do at a world cup. For this, we need to know roughly what their ranking would be compared to actual nations…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - Picking Teams
item.description: First, we need a list of plausible formations, and the positions they contain. There’s a handy list of the default FIFA18 formations online which we’ll scrape…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - Finding British Player's Birthplaces
item.description: To select our county teams, we need to know where each British player was born (and thus their ‘county’ nationality)…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - LASSOs and Player Positions
item.description: The data we’ve scraped only gives a player’s overall ‘ability’ and their abilities on specific skills (e.g. strength, long shots, dribbling…). We want to use this to work out how good each player is at each position…

item.title: Could an Independent Yorkshire Win the World Cup - Data & Scraping
item.description: In order to calculate how good each county team would be, I needed a measure of the ability of all of the players they could field. For this I turned to the FIFA18 video game which rates players along a variety of scales. Once that’s scraped and bound we can take a peek at the data…

item.title: Riddler 27th April 2018
item.description: Formally this is phrased as: Some number, N, of people need to pee, and there is some number, M, of urinals in a row in a men’s room…

item.title: Hello World! And A Small Chess Plotting Package
item.description: To copy the readme mini-vignette provides a nice overview of the uber-function which goes from pgn -> gif. There’s also a load of semi-arranged smaller functions used to work out the positions of the pieces and plot the board etc…
